title: Does  not work on Samsung Galaxy Tab 2
comment: As noted by another user, cannot set time.  Get a "generic error"
Please try new version 1.9. If that does not fix your problem try installing Busybox. On some devices binaries needed by NTPSync are broken.

comment: Seems to remain blocked by firewall No other app has this issue Uninstalled
I don't think a Android firewall will block NTP requests. Please try new version 1.9.

title: Really bad.
comment: This app set the time on my Xperia j to january 1980 and almost caused a disastrous crash. It wrote some stupid xml file to my external sd which stopped it from booting. Bah.
NTP-Sync doesn't write anything on the sd card, your rebooting problem must be caused by another app.

title: Does what expected.
comment: Fast and simple. Really good for me!

title: Great tool!
comment: Does what it sets out too very well. Thanks dev!
Works well. Would be nice if I could customize query frequency. Requires root access.

That's exactly what I need

title: Nice
comment: Just works!

title: Brilliant!
comment: It's not often that you come across an app with straightforward permissions, simple and effective interface, and working well. This is one of those.

title: What the doctor ordered
comment: I just downloaded this so,going to give it a test. Unlike others, I only require syncing once daily and/or upon boot. My device receives a restart daily anyway to free up RAM and optimize DB and cache. Plus, I like the consistency of use in the Holo-style.
Clocksynch works better for my fone...god knows why?

title: Daylight SAvings Time
comment: I've not run across any app that can correct for DST.  My device has no such facility either, so as a result my time is offset by an hour half the year. If this were added to the app, it would just be the cat's a**.

title: nice
comment: does what it should (Dell Streak, StreakDroid)

title: Really well done
comment: This Dev is golden!  I'd like to see a server database function in a Donate/pay version.

title: Works great
comment: Just what I needed, since my phone used to reset time if I wasn't connected to cell network. Now I can airplane mode and wifi on.

title: Ummm...
comment: How is it an "alternative to ClockSync" when it only syncs on demand and at boot, and NOT on a schedule? OK, so now it has been updated and can sync once a day (I wish that was often enough for my phone). I downloaded it again, installed it, and hit "Query and set time!". (Why is an exclamation point used there?) It set my phone to a date over a year into the future. My phone went nuts--Titanium Backup schedules that are set to trigger in the middle of the night ran immediately. When I corrected the time with an app that isn't garbage, my weather alert app stopped updating because its "next poll time" was far in the future, etc. I think I'm done with this app... forever.

title: Nice and simple, does not need position and other rubbish
comment: You should rename it for better exposure though - at least include the words clock and time!

title: good app, but need help with displayed info
comment: where can i find out more about the various parameters displayed when i select 'detailed query'  some are intuitive, but would like further explanation.  cheers

title: Wonderful!
comment: THANK YOU!

title: Does what it says
comment: Useful timesync.  Note:needs rooted device to set time. Unrooted devices can only query ntp.

title: Does as it says
